changed.text:
Ta konfiguracja kodu zaproszenia została zmieniona.

Użyj `{{ prefix }}inviteCodeConfig {{ key }} {{ code }} <value>` by zmienić to ponownie.
Użyj `{{ prefix }}inviteCodeConfig {{ key }} {{ code }} none` by zresetować go do domyślnego.

current.clear: Użyj `{{ prefix }}inviteCodeConfig {{ key }} {{ code }} none` żeby to wyczyścić.
current.notSet:
Ta konfiguracja kodu zaproszenia **nie** jest aktualnie ustawiona.

Użyj `{{ prefix }}inviteCodeConfig {{ key }} {{ code }} <value>` aby ją ustawić.
current.text:
Aktualnie konfiguracja kodu zaproszenia jest ustawiona.

Użyj `{{ prefix }}inviteCodeConfig {{ key }} {{ code }} <value>`, aby ją zmienić.
Użyj `{{ prefix }}inviteCodeConfig {{ key }} {{ code }} default`, aby zresetować do wartości domyślnej.
Użyj `{{ prefix }}inviteCodeConfig {{ key }} {{ code }} none\`, aby wyczyścić.
current.title: Obecna wartość

memberConfig.canNotClear: Ustawienia konfiguracji członka ** {{ key }} ** nie można wyczyścić. Możesz użyć `memberConfig {{ key }} default`, aby zresetować go do wartości domyślnej.

changed.text:
This member config has been changed.

Use `{{ prefix }}memberConfig {{ key }} {{ username }} <value>` to change it again.
Use `{{ prefix }}memberConfig {{ key }} {{ username }} none` to reset it to the default.

current.notSet:
This member config is currently **not** set.

Use `{{ prefix }}memberConfig {{ key }} {{ username }} <value>` to set it.
current.text:
This member config is currently set.

Use `{{ prefix }}memberConfig {{ key }} {{ username }} <value>` to change it.
Use `{{ prefix }}memberConfig {{ key }} {{ username }} default` to reset it to the default.
Use `{{ prefix }}memberConfig {{ key }} {{ username }} none\` to clear it.
current.title: Aktualna wartość

memberConfig.notSet: This member config settings is currently not set for any members
memberConfig.sameValue: Ta konfiguracja członka jest już ustawiona na tę wartość

self.description: Pokaż i zmień konfigurację członków serwera.

memberConfig.text:
Below are all the available member config settings.

Use `{{ prefix }}memberConfig <key>` to view the users which have a `<key>` setting
Use `{{ prefix }}memberConfig <key> @user` to view the setting for a single `@user`
Use `{{ prefix }}memberConfig <key> @user <value>` to set the config `<key>` to `<value>` for `@user`
memberConfig.title: Konfiguracja członka

self.description: Pokaż liczbę członków bieżącego serwera.

help.text: If you need help or have feedback, you can either use the `!feedback` command or join our discord support server: {{{ link }}}
help.title: Help

joinLeave.text: If you want to display join and or leave messages in one of your channels, you have to configure that channel by doing `!config joinMessageChannel #channel` or `!config leaveMessageChannel #channel`. Make sure the bot has write permissions in those channels!
joinLeave.title: Setting join and leave message channel

manageGuild.text: The bot does not have the "Manage Server" permission. This permission is required to read the invites of the user. Without this permission the join messages won't work.
manageGuild.title: Missing permission: Manage Server

manageRoles.text: The bot does not have the "Manage Roles" permissions. This permission is required to assign roles to a user. Without this permission members cannot be auto-promoted.
manageRoles.title: Missing permission: Manage Roles

prefix.text:
You can change the prefix by doing `!config prefix !`

If you don't know the bots prefix, you can find it using `@InviteManager config prefix`.
prefix.title: Changing the prefix

premium.text:
If you would like to support the development of this bot, you can do so by supporting us on Patreon: {{{ link }}}

Depending on the tier, you will get some additional features.
premium.title: Premium

self.description: Help with setting up the bot and checking for problems (e.g. missing permissions)

setup.text: After inviting the bot, all invites will be tracked automatically.
setup.title: Setting up InviteManager

viewAuditLogs.text: The bot does not have the `View Audit Logs` permissions. This permission allows the bot to better track invites.
viewAuditLogs.title: Missing permission: View Audit Logs

tryPremium.text: You can try out our premium features for {{ duration }}. You can only do this once. Would you like to test it now?
tryPremium.title: InviteManager - Try Premium

self.description: Disconnect the bot from the current voice channel.
Show lyrics of the currently playing song.

flags.live: If set, then the lyrics will sync with the current time of the song.

lyrics.notFound: No lyrics found for this song!
lyrics.notSupported: The lyrics command is not supported on {{ platform }}.

self.description: Create a mashup of 2 songs.

args.videos: The videos that should be mashed together.

self.description: Shows information about the currently playing song

flags.pin: Pin the now playing message and update it automatically whenever a new song plays.

self.description: Pause the current song.
Play the song if the queue is empty, otherwise it will add the song to the end of the queue.

flags.platform: Select the platform where you want the song to be played.
flags.next: If set, it will play this song next instead of adding it to the end of the queue.

args.link: The link to a specific song or a search term.

self.description: Display the songs in the queue.

queue.empty: Queue is currently empty. Use the play command to add songs to it.

self.description: Set the song to be played on repeat.

repeat.enabled: This song will now play on repeat.
repeat.disabled: This song will not be played on repeat anymore.

self.description: Resume the current song.
Rewind the song and start from the beginning.

rewind.notSupported: Rewinding is not supported on {{{ platform }}}

self.description: Search for the search term and let you chose one of the results.

flags.platform: Select the platform where you want the song to be played.

search.title: Results for {{ term }}
search.notSupported: Searching is not supported on {{{ platform }}}

self.description: Skip to a specific part of the song.

args.duration: The position the song will be skipped to (from the beginning, in seconds).

seek.notSupported: Seeking is not supported on {{{ platform }}}

self.description: Skip the current song and play the next song in the queue.

args.amount: How many songs will be skipped.

self.description: Set the volume if an argument is passed, or show the current volume.

args.volume: The value the volume will be set to.

messages.joinUnknownInviter: I can't figure out how <@{{ id }}> joined the server.
messages.joinVanityUrl: <@{{ id }}> joined the server using a vanity invite.
messages.leaveUnknownInviter: {{ tag }} left the server, but I couldn't figure out who invited them.
messages.joinServerWidget: The user joined using a server widget.
messages.joinLeaveEmbedsIsPremium: Using an embed as your join/leave message is a premium feature. Premium does not seem to be active on this server. Please contact us to learn more about how to purchase premium.

strikes.dm: You have received **{{ amount }}** strikes for violating the **{{ type }}** rule in **{{ guild }}**

permissions.adminOnly:
You do not have permission to use this command.
Only **Administrators** may use this command.
permissions.premiumOnly: This command is only available for premium subscribers!
permissions.rateLimit: Slow down! Please wait {{ cooldown }} seconds and try again.
permissions.role:
You do not have permission to use this command.
You need one of the following roles: {{{ roles }}}
permissions.missing: InviteManager is missing the permissions {{{ permissions }}} in {{{ channel }}}

boolean.typeInfo: This arguments expects `true` or `false`. You can also use `yes` and `no`.

channel.typeInfo:
This arguments expects a Discord Channel. You can use any of the following methods to provide a channel:

- Mention the channel: `#general`
- Use the ID: `409846838129197057`
- Use the name: `general`
- Use quotes if the name has a space: `"general with a space"`

command.validValues: Use one of the following values: {{{ values }}}
command.typeInfo:
This argument expects a command of this bot. You can use any of the following methods to provide a command:

- Use the command name: `invites`
- Use an alias of the command: `p`

enum.validValues: Use one of the following values: {{{ values }}}
enum.typeInfo:
This arguments expects a value from a specific set of valid values.  

> Depending on the command the valid values can vary. Use `!help <command>` (eg. `!help addRank`) to get more information about the command and the valid values for the enum.

number.tooSmall: That number is too small, it has to be at least {{{ min }}}.
number.tooLarge: That number is too large, it has to be at most {{{ max }}}.

role.typeInfo:
This arguments expects a Discord Role. You can use any of the following methods to provide a role:

- Mention the role: `@Admin`
- Use the ID: `102785693046026240`
- Use the name: `Admin`
- Use quotes if the name has a space: `"Admin with a space"`

user.typeInfo:
This arguments expects a Discord User. You can use any of the following methods to provide a user:

- Mention the user: `@Valandur`
- Use their ID: `102785693046026240`
- Use their name: `Valandur`
- Use their name and discriminator: `Valandur#3581`
- Use quotes if their name has a space: `"Valandur with a space"`

string.typeInfo:
This arguments expects any text. You can use quotes (`"Text with quotes"`) for text that has spaces.  

> If the text is the last argument you don't have to use quotes.

date.typeInfo: This argument expects a date. You can use various formats, but we recommend: `YYYY-MM-DD`

duration.typeInfo:
This argument expects a duration. The following duration types are supported:

- Seconds: `s` (`5s` = 5 seconds)
- Minutes: `min` (`3min` = 3 minutes)
- Hours: `h` (`4h` = 4 hours)
- Days: `d` (`2d` = 2 days)
- Weeks: `w` (`1w` = 1 week)
- Months: `mo` (`6mo` = 6 months)
- Years: `y` (`10y` = 10 years)

invitecode.typeInfo:
This arguments expects a Discord Invite Code.  

> You can put only the part after `https://discord.gg/` to prevent Discord from creating a preview.
invitecode.notFound: The specified invite code could not be found.

autoModAllCapsEnabled.title: Enabled
autoModAllCapsEnabled.description: Automatically moderate messages with A LOT OF CAPS.

autoModAllCapsMinCharacters.title: Min. Characters
autoModAllCapsMinCharacters.description: The minimum amount of characters in a message to be considered for moderating (setting to '3' would ignore 'OK').

autoModAllCapsPercentageCaps.title: Percentage CAPs
autoModAllCapsPercentageCaps.description: The percentage of characters of the message that have to be CAPs for the rule to trigger.

autoModDeleteBotMessage.title: Delete Bot Messages
autoModDeleteBotMessage.description: Automatically delete the bots own messages (keeps your chat clean).

autoModDeleteBotMessageTimeoutInSeconds.title: Delete Bot Message Timeout
autoModDeleteBotMessageTimeoutInSeconds.description: The timeout after which bot messages are deleted.

autoModDisabledForOldMembers.title: Disabled for Old Members
autoModDisabledForOldMembers.description: Disabled auto moderation for members that have been in your server for a long time.

autoModDisabledForOldMembersThreshold.title: Old Members Threshold
autoModDisabledForOldMembersThreshold.description: The amount of time a member has to be in your server to be considered 'old'.

autoModDuplicateTextTimeframeInSeconds.title: Timeframe in Seconds
autoModDuplicateTextTimeframeInSeconds.description: The timeframe whithin which messages will be considered duplicates.

autoModEmojisEnabled.title: Enabled
autoModEmojisEnabled.description: Automatically moderate messages with an excessive amount of emojis.

autoModEmojisMaxNumberOfEmojis.title: Max # of Emojis
autoModEmojisMaxNumberOfEmojis.description: The maximum amount of emojis a message is allowed to have before trigger the rule.

autoModEnabled.title: Enabled
autoModEnabled.description: Automatically moderate messages (specific rules can also be turned on or off, this has to be ON for ANY rule to work).

autoModHoistEnabled.title: Enabled
autoModHoistEnabled.description: Automatically give members nicknames if they try to hoist (use special characters to appear at the top of the user list).

autoModIgnoredChannels.title: Ignored Channels
autoModIgnoredChannels.description: Channels that are ignored while automatically moderating.

autoModIgnoredRoles.title: Ignored Roles
autoModIgnoredRoles.description: Any members with these roles will not automatically be moderated.

autoModInvitesEnabled.title: Enabled
autoModInvitesEnabled.description: Automatically scan messages for discord invite links and remove them.

autoModLinksBlacklist.title: Blacklist
autoModLinksBlacklist.description: Blacklist certain links which users won't be able to post.

autoModLinksEnabled.title: Enabled
autoModLinksEnabled.description: Automatically remove messages containing links (you can set a whitelist and blacklist).

autoModLinksFollowRedirects.title: Follow Redirects
autoModLinksFollowRedirects.description: Enable this to resolve redirects for links.

autoModLinksWhitelist.title: Whitelist
autoModLinksWhitelist.description: A list of links that users are allowed to post.

autoModLogEnabled.title: Log Enabled
autoModLogEnabled.description: Log any moderation actions that the bot makes.

autoModMentionRolesEnabled.title: Enabled
autoModMentionRolesEnabled.description: Automatically moderate messages that mention an excessive amount of roles.

autoModMentionRolesMaxNumberOfMentions.title: Max # of Mentions
autoModMentionRolesMaxNumberOfMentions.description: The maximum amount of roles a member can mention in a message.

autoModMentionUsersEnabled.title: Enabled
autoModMentionUsersEnabled.description: Automatically moderate messages that mention an excessive amount of users.

autoModMentionUsersMaxNumberOfMentions.title: Max # of Mentions
autoModMentionUsersMaxNumberOfMentions.description: The maximum amount of users a member can mention in a message.

autoModModeratedChannels.title: Moderated Channels
autoModModeratedChannels.description: The list of moderated channels (this acts as a whitelist, leave empty to moderate all channels, or use `autoModIgnoredChannels` to ignore certain channels).

autoModModeratedRoles.title: Moderated Roles
autoModModeratedRoles.description: The list of roles that are moderated (this acts as a whitelist, leave empty to moderate all roles, or use `autoModIgnoredRoles` to ignore certain roles).

autoModQuickMessagesEnabled.title: Enabled
autoModQuickMessagesEnabled.description: Automatically moderate users sending a lot of messages in a short time.

autoModQuickMessagesNumberOfMessages.title: # of Messages
autoModQuickMessagesNumberOfMessages.description: The number of messages that have to be sent within the timeframe to trigger the rule.

autoModQuickMessagesTimeframeInSeconds.title: Timeframe in Seconds
autoModQuickMessagesTimeframeInSeconds.description: The timeframe within which a user is allowed to send a maximum amount of messages.

autoModWordsBlacklist.description: A list of words that are banned.
autoModWordsBlacklist.title: Blacklist

autoModWordsEnabled.description: Whether or not blacklisted words will be automoderated.
autoModWordsEnabled.title: Enabled

autoSubtractLeaves.description: Automatically remove invites from the inviter when the invited user leaves.
autoSubtractLeaves.title: Auto Subtract

autoSubtractLeaveThreshold.description: The time in seconds for which a user has to stay in the server for the invite to count.
autoSubtractLeaveThreshold.title: Auto Subtract Threshold

captchaVerificationFailedMessage.description: The message sent to the user if he enters an invalid captcha.
captchaVerificationFailedMessage.title: Failed Message

captchaVerificationLogEnabled.description: Whether or not verification attempts will be logged.
captchaVerificationLogEnabled.title: Log Enabled

captchaVerificationOnJoin.description: Whether or not captcha verification is enabled.
captchaVerificationOnJoin.title: Enabled

captchaVerificationSuccessMessage.description: The welcome message that will be sent to the user after he successfully verifies.
captchaVerificationSuccessMessage.title: Success Message

captchaVerificationTimeout.description: The time within which the captcha has to be entered successfully.
captchaVerificationTimeout.title: Verification Timeout

captchaVerificationWelcomeMessage.description: The message a user will get after joining a server and instructing them to enter the captcha.
captchaVerificationWelcomeMessage.title: Welcome Message
